summary: The Fit to Serve Act, introduced in the Senate, aims to prohibit discrimination against individuals in the Armed Forces based on their gender identity. The bill amends Title 10 of the United States Code to prevent the Secretary concerned from, among other things, prescribing qualifications, involuntarily separating members, denying healthcare coverage, or denying service based on gender identity. It defines gender identity broadly to encompass gender-related characteristics and provides a definition for the term.
